keyword: how many calories are in seminal fluid
title: How Many Calories Are in Seminal Fluid?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in seminal fluid per average ejaculation, including carbs, protein, and other nutrients for this unique query.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Seminal Fluid?
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3-5 ml volume); composition based on typical fructose, proteins, and minerals; not a dietary staple.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies greatly by individual health, diet, hydration, and frequency; values are approximate and not intended for consumption. Consult medical sources.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of seminal fluid contains about 15 kcal, primarily from sugars and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in seminal fluid per ejaculation?
faqs.a: Approximately 15 kcal for an average 3-5 ml ejaculation.

faqs.q: What nutrients are in seminal fluid besides calories?
faqs.a: Mainly 2 g carbs (mostly sugars), 0.5 g protein, and trace fats; also minerals like zinc and sodium.

faqs.q: Does diet affect calories in seminal fluid?
faqs.a: Yes, higher sugar intake can increase fructose and thus calories slightly.

faqs.q: Is seminal fluid high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only about 0.5 g per ejaculationâ€”minimal compared to food sources.

faqs.q: How variable are the calories in seminal fluid?
faqs.a: Highly variable (5-25 kcal) based on volume, health, and lifestyle factors.
